div.class: ml-slider-3-15-3 metaslider metaslider-flex metaslider-3007 ml-slider nav-hidden

div.p: Every school district in the Commonwealth must provide a plan for instructing students during this time of closure (the state is calling it a Continuity of Education Plan) . Districts have three options to choose from based on what each district can provide to their students. The Jersey Shore Area School District is utilizing the “Enrichment & Review” option. The other two options are not viable for our district at this time, but we are continuing to pursue additional options for the future. The state and federal government have made it clear that if districts decided to continue with new material for students (the options that are called “Planned Instruction” and a “Hybrid Plan”), the district would need to ensure all aspects of FAPE (Free Appropriate Public Education). We can, and are, providing the enrichment and review opportunities that we are allowed to do without violating FAPE. There is a lot that goes into FAPE, but one of the biggest hurdles for our district is access and connectivity (high speed internet access throughout the district or even adequate cell service throughout the district if we utilized hotspots). There are also many programs we are not able to do virtually…yet. That brings me to the next point. The teachers/staff are working virtually. They are working very hard at creating a system and structure that will allow us to apply to the state to be able to continue with new instruction in the future (like for flexible snow days). I can assure you that our teachers want to do more to reach and teach their students, but we have to do so within the legal requirements we are provided. We will be adding a FAQ section below to help provide clarification on items. The FAQ section will be added next week. Deleted: The activities below are for enrichment and review purposes, and do get updated. The links below are sorted by grade level and are open to all students who would like to explore these optional activities. Again, these activities are optional and students will not be held accountable in any way for these activities.
Additional resources here from WVIA (PBS Station).
